intro: Diplopterys erianthera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
